headline.main: HALIFAX DISCUSSES FATE OF GERMANY; Says What to Do With Nation's 'Debased Minds' After the War Is Difficult Problem SUGGESTS RE-EDUCATION Bishop Manning, at Church Club, Pays Tribute to Heroism of MacArthur and His Men

lead_paragraph: The problem of what to do about Germany after the war was discussed last night by Viscount Halifax, the British Ambassador to the United States, in a speech at the fifty-fifth annual dinner of the Church Club of New York at the Waldorf-Astoria.
